title: Derive the Power Set, Infinity and Choice Axioms

blocks.name: grothpw
blocks.content: Derive the Axiom of Power Sets ~ ax-pow from the Tarski-Grothendieck axiom ~ ax-groth . That it follows is mentioned by Bob Solovay at ~ http://www.cs.nyu.edu/pipermail/fom/2008-March/012783.html . Note that ~ ax-pow is not used by the proof. (Contributed by Gérard Lang, 22-Jun-2009.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm grothpw(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wal(s2, wi(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s3)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
} = {
  mpbi(wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wal(s2, wi(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s3)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))), wcel(cpw(cv(s3)), universe))
  exlimiiv(s0, wcel(cpw(cv(s3)), universe), w3a(wcel(cv(s3), cv(s0)), wral(s1, cv(s0), wa(wss(cpw(cv(s1)), cv(s0)), wrex(s2, cv(s0), wss(cpw(cv(s1)), cv(s2))))), wral(s1, cpw(cv(s0)), wo(wbr(cv(s1), cen, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))))
  3syl(w3a(wcel(cv(s3), cv(s0)), wral(s1, cv(s0), wa(wss(cpw(cv(s1)), cv(s0)), wrex(s2, cv(s0), wss(cpw(cv(s1)), cv(s2))))), wral(s1, cpw(cv(s0)), wo(wbr(cv(s1), cen, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))), wcel(cpw(cv(s3)), universe), wa(wcel(cv(s3), cv(s0)), wi(wcel(cv(s3), cv(s0)), wss(cpw(cv(s3)), cv(s0)))), wss(cpw(cv(s3)), cv(s0)))
  3adant3(wcel(cv(s3), cv(s0)), wral(s1, cv(s0), wa(wss(cpw(cv(s1)), cv(s0)), wrex(s2, cv(s0), wss(cpw(cv(s1)), cv(s2))))), wral(s1, cpw(cv(s0)), wo(wbr(cv(s1), cen, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wa(wcel(cv(s3), cv(s0)), wi(wcel(cv(s3), cv(s0)), wss(cpw(cv(s3)), cv(s0)))))
  anim2i(wcel(cv(s3), cv(s0)), wral(s1, cv(s0), wa(wss(cpw(cv(s1)), cv(s0)), wrex(s2, cv(s0), wss(cpw(cv(s1)), cv(s2))))), wi(wcel(cv(s3), cv(s0)), wss(cpw(cv(s3)), cv(s0))))
  syl(wral(s1, cv(s0), wa(wss(cpw(cv(s1)), cv(s0)), wrex(s2, cv(s0), wss(cpw(cv(s1)), cv(s2))))), wi(wcel(cv(s3), cv(s0)), wss(cpw(cv(s3)), cv(s0))), wral(s1, cv(s0), wss(cpw(cv(s1)), cv(s0))))
  ralimi(s1, cv(s0), wa(wss(cpw(cv(s1)), cv(s0)), wrex(s2, cv(s0), wss(cpw(cv(s1)), cv(s2)))), wss(cpw(cv(s1)), cv(s0)))
  simpl(wss(cpw(cv(s1)), cv(s0)), wrex(s2, cv(s0), wss(cpw(cv(s1)), cv(s2))))
  rspccv(s1, cv(s0), cv(s3), wss(cpw(cv(s1)), cv(s0)), wss(cpw(cv(s3)), cv(s0)))
  sseq1d(cpw(cv(s1)), cv(s0), cpw(cv(s3)), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s3)))
  pweq(cv(s1), cv(s3))
  pm3.35(wcel(cv(s3), cv(s0)), wss(cpw(cv(s3)), cv(s0)))
  ssex(cpw(cv(s3)), cv(s0))
  vex(s0)
  axgroth5(s0, s3, s1, s2)
  axpweq(s0, s1, s2, cv(s3))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cpw(cv(s3)), universe)
  diff.cpw.s(s0, cv(s3))
  diff.universe.s(s0)
  diff.wss.s(s1, cpw(cv(s3)), cv(s0))
  diff.cpw.s(s1, cv(s3))
  diff.cv.s(s1, s3)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s3, s1)
  diffss.ex(s3, s2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s3)
  diff.cv.s(s2, s3)
}

blocks.name: grothpwex
blocks.content: Derive the Axiom of Power Sets from the Tarski-Grothendieck axiom ~ ax-groth . Note that ~ ax-pow is not used by the proof. Use ~ axpweq to obtain ~ ax-pow . Use ~ pwex or ~ pwexg instead. (Contributed by Gérard Lang, 22-Jun-2009.) (New usage is discouraged.)

} = {

  syl(wral(hs1, cv(hs0), wa(wss(cpw(cv(hs1)), cv(hs0)), wrex(hs2, cv(hs0), wss(cpw(cv(hs1)), cv(hs2))))), wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wss(cpw(cv(s0)), cv(hs0))), wral(hs1, cv(hs0), wss(cpw(cv(hs1)), cv(hs0))))

  sseq1d(cpw(cv(hs1)), cv(hs0), cpw(cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s0)))
  pweq(cv(hs1), cv(s0))
  pm3.35(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wss(cpw(cv(s0)), cv(hs0)))
  ssex(cpw(cv(s0)), cv(hs0))
  vex(hs0)
  axgroth5(hs0, s0, hs1, hs2)

blocks.name: axgroth6
blocks.content: The Tarski-Grothendieck axiom using abbreviations. This version is called Tarski's axiom: given a set ` x ` , there exists a set ` y ` containing ` x ` , the subsets of the members of ` y ` , the power sets of the members of ` y ` , and the subsets of ` y ` of cardinality less than that of ` y ` . (Contributed by NM, 21-Jun-2009.)
blocks.origin:

  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
} = {
  mpbir(wex(s0, w3a(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wral(s2, cv(s0), wa(wss(cpw(cv(s2)), cv(s0)), wcel(cpw(cv(s2)), cv(s0)))), wral(s2, cpw(cv(s0)), wi(wbr(cv(s2), csdm, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s0)))))), wex(s0, w3a(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wral(s2, cv(s0), wa(wss(cpw(cv(s2)), cv(s0)), wrex(hs0, cv(s0), wss(cpw(cv(s2)), cv(hs0))))), wral(s2, cpw(cv(s0)), wo(wbr(cv(s2), cen, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s0)))))))

  rspccv(hs1, cv(s0), cv(hs0), wss(cpw(cv(hs1)), cv(s0)), wss(cpw(cv(hs0)), cv(s0)))

blocks.name: grothomex
blocks.content: The Tarski-Grothendieck Axiom implies the Axiom of Infinity (in the form of ~ omex ). Note that our proof depends on neither the Axiom of Infinity nor Regularity. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Apr-2013.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: grothac
blocks.content: The Tarski-Grothendieck Axiom implies the Axiom of Choice (in the form of ~ cardeqv ). This can be put in a more conventional form via ~ ween and ~ dfac8 . Note that the mere existence of strongly inaccessible cardinals doesn't imply AC, but rather the particular form of the Tarski-Grothendieck axiom (see ~ http://www.cs.nyu.edu/pipermail/fom/2008-March/012783.html ). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Apr-2013.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: grothtsk
blocks.content: The Tarski-Grothendieck Axiom, using abbreviations. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-May-2013.)

thm grothtsk() {

} = {
  eqriv(hs0, cuni(ctsk), universe)
  2th(wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(ctsk)), wcel(cv(hs0), universe))
  mpbir(wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(ctsk)), wex(hs1, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), ctsk))))
  mpbir(wex(hs1, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), ctsk))), wex(hs1, w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wa(wss(cpw(cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)), wrex(hs3, cv(hs1), wss(cpw(cv(hs2)), cv(hs3))))), wral(hs2, cpw(cv(hs1)), wo(wbr(cv(hs2), cen, cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs2), cv(hs1)))))))
  axgroth5(hs1, hs0, hs2, hs3)
  exbii(hs1, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), ctsk)), w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wa(wss(cpw(cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)), wrex(hs3, cv(hs1), wss(cpw(cv(hs2)), cv(hs3))))), wral(hs2, cpw(cv(hs1)), wo(wbr(cv(hs2), cen, cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs2), cv(hs1))))))
  bitr4i(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), ctsk)), w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wa(wss(cpw(cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)), wrex(hs3, cv(hs1), wss(cpw(cv(hs2)), cv(hs3))))), wral(hs2, cpw(cv(hs1)), wo(wbr(cv(hs2), cen, cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs2), cv(hs1))))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wa(wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wa(wss(cpw(cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)), wrex(hs3, cv(hs1), wss(cpw(cv(hs2)), cv(hs3))))), wral(hs2, cpw(cv(hs1)), wo(wbr(cv(hs2), cen, cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs2), cv(hs1)))))))
  anbi2i(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), ctsk), wa(wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wa(wss(cpw(cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)), wrex(hs3, cv(hs1), wss(cpw(cv(hs2)), cv(hs3))))), wral(hs2, cpw(cv(hs1)), wo(wbr(cv(hs2), cen, cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs2), cv(hs1))))))
  elv(hs1, wb(wcel(cv(hs1), ctsk), wa(wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wa(wss(cpw(cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)), wrex(hs3, cv(hs1), wss(cpw(cv(hs2)), cv(hs3))))), wral(hs2, cpw(cv(hs1)), wo(wbr(cv(hs2), cen, cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs2), cv(hs1)))))))
  eltskg(hs2, hs3, cv(hs1), universe)
  3anass(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wa(wss(cpw(cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)), wrex(hs3, cv(hs1), wss(cpw(cv(hs2)), cv(hs3))))), wral(hs2, cpw(cv(hs1)), wo(wbr(cv(hs2), cen, cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs2), cv(hs1)))))
  eluni(hs1, cv(hs0), ctsk)
  vex(hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(cuni(ctsk))
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs3)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.s(hs3)
  diff.hs2.s(hs3)
  diff.hs2.c(cv(hs1))
  diff.hs3.c(cv(hs1))
  diff.hs1.c(cv(hs0))

}

blocks.name: inaprc
blocks.content: An equivalent to the Tarski-Grothendieck Axiom: there is a proper class of inaccessible cardinals. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jun-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm inaprc() {
  |- wnel(cina, universe)
} = {
  mpbir(wnel(cina, universe), wceq(cuni(cina), con0))
  eqssi(cuni(cina), con0)
  mp2b(wss(cuni(cina), con0), wss(cina, con0), word(cuni(cina)))
  ssorduni(cina)
  ordsson(cuni(cina))
  ssriv(hs1, con0, cuni(cina))
  sylibr(wcel(cv(hs1), con0), wcel(cv(hs1), cuni(cina)), wrex(hs2, cina, wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))))
  mpi(wcel(cv(hs1), con0), wrex(hs2, cina, wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))), wrex(hs3, ctsk, wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs3))))
  mpbi(wrex(hs3, ctsk, wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs3))), wcel(cv(hs1), cuni(ctsk)))
  eleqtrri(cv(hs1), cuni(ctsk), universe)
  vex(hs1)
  grothtsk()
  eluni2(hs3, cv(hs1), ctsk)
  rexlimdvaa(hs3, ctsk, wcel(cv(hs1), con0), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs3)), wrex(hs2, cina, wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))))
  syl2an2(wcel(cv(hs1), con0), wa(wcel(cv(hs3), ctsk), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs3))), wrex(hs2, cina, wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))), wcel(cfv(ccrd, cv(hs3)), cina), wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(ccrd, cv(hs3))))
  sylan2(wcel(cv(hs3), ctsk), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs3)), wcel(cfv(ccrd, cv(hs3)), cina), wne(cv(hs3), emptycls))
  ne0i(cv(hs1), cv(hs3))
  tskcard(cv(hs3))
  mpbid(wa(wcel(cv(hs1), con0), wa(wcel(cv(hs3), ctsk), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs3)))), wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(ccrd, cv(hs3))), wbr(cv(hs1), csdm, cv(hs3)))
  adantl(wcel(cv(hs1), con0), wa(wcel(cv(hs3), ctsk), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs3))), wbr(cv(hs1), csdm, cv(hs3)))
  tsksdom(cv(hs3), cv(hs1))
  sylan2(wcel(cv(hs1), con0), wa(wcel(cv(hs3), ctsk), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs3))), wb(wbr(cv(hs1), csdm, cv(hs3)), wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(ccrd, cv(hs3)))), wcel(cv(hs3), cdm(ccrd)))
  adantr(wcel(cv(hs3), ctsk), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs3)), wcel(cv(hs3), cdm(ccrd)))
  tskwe2(cv(hs3))
  cardsdomel(cv(hs1), cv(hs3))
  rspcev(hs2, cfv(ccrd, cv(hs3)), cina, wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(ccrd, cv(hs3))), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)))
  eleq2(cv(hs2), cfv(ccrd, cv(hs3)), cv(hs1))
  eluni2(hs2, cv(hs1), cina)
  ax-mp(wb(wnel(cina, universe), wceq(cuni(cina), con0)), wss(cina, con0))
  ssriv(hs0, cina, con0)
  syl(wcel(cv(hs0), cina), wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wcel(cv(hs0), cwina))
  inawina(cv(hs0))
  winaon(cv(hs0))
  ssonprc(cina)
  diff.hs0.c(cina)
  diff.hs0.c(con0)
  diff.hs1.c(con0)
  diff.hs1.c(cuni(cina))
  diff.hs3.c(cv(hs1))
  diff.hs3.c(ctsk)
  diff.hs3.w(wcel(cv(hs1), con0))
  diff.hs3.w(wrex(hs2, cina, wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))))
  diff.hs2.c(cfv(ccrd, cv(hs3)))
  diff.hs2.c(cina)
  diff.hs2.w(wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(ccrd, cv(hs3))))
  diff.hs2.c(cv(hs1))
}
